intro: Pimpinella rivae, commonly known as the river cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant typically grows in moist, rocky soils along riverbanks and mountainous areas. It features finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in early spring. Pimpinella rivae is often found in open habitats and is known for its delicate appearance and ecological importance to local wildlife.
